intro: Odontocarya nitida, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Odontocarya nitida is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
